cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 625 mi (1005 km) SE of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic and expected to turn northwest toward the North-Carolina/South-Carolina coast late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina (near Cape Fear-Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impact zone currently from the South Carolina coast northward to the southern Mid-Atlantic (NC/VA)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Friday into Saturday; otherwise breezy with gusts mainly below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at this time for New York Harbor given track toward the Carolinas.
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers with locally heavy rain possible Friday night-Saturday as Florence’s remnant moisture gets drawn northward, but widespread 4-inch totals are not indicated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and dangerous rip currents already affecting the New Jersey and Long Island beaches.
